section.section: Except as otherwise provided under § 10-226 of the State Government Article, before the Board takes any action to deny a license or to reject or modify a delegation agreement or advanced duty, the Board shall give the applicant or licensee the opportunity for a hearing before the Board.
The Board shall give notice and hold the hearing under Title 10, Subtitle 2 of the State Government Article.
The Board may administer oaths in connection with any proceeding under this section.
At least 14 days before the hearing, the hearing notice shall be sent to the last known address of the applicant or licensee.

text.section:
Any applicant aggrieved under this subtitle by a final decision of the Board denying a license or rejecting or modifying a delegation agreement or advanced duty may:
Appeal that decision to the Board of Review; and
Then take any further appeal allowed under Title 10, Subtitle 2 of the State Government Article.
